intro: Relbunium chaetophorum, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Relbunium chaetophorum is often found in dry, open habitats such as slopes and cliffs.
